ISSUE.TITLE: Feature: Add a settings per projects and/or per tables for the pagination and number of rows shown
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Please confirm if feature request does NOT exist already ? - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this ### Describe the usecase for the feature Currently, the only way to change the number of rows displayed, is to change the environment variable (see https://docs.nocodb.com/getting-started/self-hosted/environment-variables/) `DB_QUERY_LIMIT_DEFAULT`. ### Suggested Solution It would be great to be able to change that number per projects, and even per tables (since you can have a case where you want your users to be able to sift through huge number of rows for simple tables, but want to prevent overloading your server with more complex tables). ### Additional Context Ideally, this feature would allow the user to change the default 25 rows limit without having to change the env variable. This feature could play well with the [infinite scroll feature request](https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/issues/3568) as well.
